author: Kim Hébert
text:
HS as/is Sedgwickian…  
#ifyouknowyouknow

“…the light that comes from him is real and infinite.” 

     — Lizzo

author: Kim Hébert
text: Health Minister Christian Dubé said Friday that 13,000 health care workers are missing because of COVID-19, and anticipated that “it’s going to be tough in the ERs over the next couple of weeks,” but said the network would hold up. https://t.co/DilQqKubJY

author: Kim Hébert
text:
we musn’t forget —

there’s a price to pay to be in the ‘pretty’ places…

and, it will be exacted.

author: Kim Hébert
text:
Everyone talks themselves into a life that suits them best.

— Elena Ferrante
     MY BRILLIANT FRIEND
     dir. Daniele Luchetti (2022)

author: Kim Hébert
text:
Beauty is deceit […]

like the sea on a calm day,

like the sky at night.

It’s face powder applied over horror.

If we remove it, we are left alone with our fear.

— Elena Ferrante
     MY BRILLIANT FRIEND
     dir. Saverio Costanzo (2020)

author: Kim Hébert
text:
Never finish […]

You must always study.

— Elena Ferrante
     MY BRILLIANT FRIEND
     dir. Saverio Costanzo (2018)

author: Kim Hébert
text:
I don’t want to read anything more of what you write […]

Because it hurts me.

— Elena Ferrante
     MY BRILLIANT FRIEND
     dir. Saverio Costanzo (2018)

author: Kim Hébert
text:
Rep. Adam Schiff, Rep. Joaquin Castro, Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo,
Attorney General Merrick Garland along with a half-dozen journalists & members of the White House and National Security Council test positive for COVID following event. https://t.co/7KzH5ntuws

author: Kim Hébert
text:
I missed her, but I didn’t have the courage to look for her.

I studied, but I didn’t know what I was studying without talking to her […]

It was as if one side of my body were always cold.

— Elena Ferrante
     MY BRILLIANT FRIEND
     dir. Saverio Costanzo (2018)

author: Kim Hébert
text:
“I open up the pail and pull out the words.”

— Elena Ferrante
     MY BRILLIANT FRIEND
     dir. Saverio Costanzo (2018)

author: Kim Hébert
text: indulgence breeds delusion.

author: Kim Hébert
text: can’t emphasize enough how important it is for us to remember that the house is on fire 🏠 🔥— that it is a burning house…  |  h/t MLK, Jr.

author: Kim Hébert
text: Omicron, somewhat milder but poorly immunogenic, is able to reinfect people sometimes over and over at intervals of a few weeks. https://t.co/6EVvU9aOIa

author: Kim Hébert
text: “If you have been subject to abuse, bullying & intimidation, what you really don’t need to hear from people in power is that they think you are ‘brave,’ or that you’re modeling perseverance & grace.“ https://t.co/l14npP6JBj

author: Kim Hébert
text:
shameful…

Dozens of projects by state & local governments were funded with federal coronavirus relief money despite having little to do with combating the pandemic, a review by the AP has found.
 https://t.co/hOjs3FSlwe

author: Kim Hébert
text:
“You do not belong to that world, and nothing
   in it belongs to you…”

    — COUNTERPART, s1e3 (2017)

author: Kim Hébert
text: “whatever you need” — those life-changing #threewords

author: Kim Hébert
text:
so many (still) don’t consider us “worthy” 

   of life 
   of health 
   of respect 
   of refuge 
   of decency

   of grace.

author: Kim Hébert
text: yesterday felt hard(er)…

author: Kim Hébert
text: good design doesn’t makes us work harder.

author: Kim Hébert
text:
“I feel as if I’m losing all my leaves…”

— THE FATHER, dir. Florian Zeller (2021)

author: Kim Hébert
text: Harlem Renaissance sculptor Augusta Savage strove to create the support she lacked… https://t.co/LXVSWFb7c1
